intro: Ennealophus euryandrus, commonly known as the broad-leafed mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on the branches of various host trees. It belongs to the family Viscaceae and is characterized by its evergreen leaves and small, white or yellowish flowers. The plant produces sticky seeds that adhere to the bark of its host, facilitating its spread. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its botanical features make it an important component of the ecosystems it inhabits.
